Bos Transjakarta Bicara Pentingnya Manajemen Bisnis Transportasi
05 Nov 2019, 09:47 by Mukhlis Dinillah


Foto: Mukhlis Dinillah/detikcom

Bandung - Implementasi manajemen pengetahuan dalam pengelolaan sebuah perusahaan menjadi penting terutama dari pengembangan sistem dan SDM. Hal itu juga yang diaplikasikan penyedia layanan transportasi massal, Transjakarta.Hal itu terungkap dalam sambutan Dirut Transjakarta Agung Wicaksono dalam Knowledge Management Summit ke-3 di Hotel Hilton, Kota Bandung, Selasa (5/11/2019). Tema yang diangkat yakni Innovative Learning To re Use Knowledge Asset In Corporation and Public Services at Society 5.0.Agung mengatakan setiap harinya Transjakarta melayani 1 juta penumpang dengan jangkauan jaringan mencapai 250 kilometer. Pihaknya mengoptimalkan sistem digital untuk memenuhi kebutuhan konsumennya."Kita harus melakukan berbagai pendekatan sebagai contoh untuk rute punya aplikasi digital namanya Tijeku, bagaimana digital digunakan untuk mengelola layanan kepada masyarakat," kata Agung dalam pemaparannya."Kita juga punya sistem command center, mengendalikan seluruh jaringan bus Transjakarta jumlahnya 3 ribu (unit) se Jabodetabek. Inilah bagaimana ilmu manajemen pengetahuan diterapkan secara praktik di perusahaan Indonesia terutama sektor transportasi," menambahkan.Selain dari segi pengembangan sistem, kompetensi SDM dalam penguasaan teknologi informasi dan digital juga harus dioptimalkan. Sehingga, sambung dia, revolusi industri 4.0 yang ada saat ini tidak menjadi ancaman justru peluang menjanjikan."Apalagi dari segi jumlah SDM transportasi sangat banyak, Transjakarta SDM 10 ribu orang, kita bicara Indonesia punya tagline SDM unggul, Indonesia maju, kuncinya SDM transportasi juga harus siap menguasai teknologi informasi dan digital dan peran manajemen pengetahuan jadi penting," tutur dia.KM-Summit 2019 yang berlangsung selama dua hari ini, menjadi wadah bersama berbagi pengetahuan, pengalaman untuk terciptanya strategi serta inovasi yang efektif dan efisien. Terutama pemanfaatan teknologi untuk mengakselerasi sebuah organisasi atau perusahaan.Dalam kegiatan ini hadir para praktisi dan akademisi di bidang KM dan Innovative Learning untuk bersama-sama mempersiapkan Modal SDM Indonesia menghadapi Era Industri 4.0 dan Era Society 5.0. Antara lain Scot Osterweil, Founder & Creative Director LGN, Aineias Gkikas dan Prof. Mark Gilman dari Birmingham City Business School, Dr. Serafin dari Filiphina, Prof. Van Hong dari Vietnam dan serta sejumlah pakar knowledge management tanah air seperti Prof. Aurik Gustomo dari SBM ITB, Anisrul Waqie Vice President Quality System and KM Pertamina, Donald C. Lantu, Eko Nugroho dan narasumber pakar lainnya. Simak Video "Bersih-bersih Halte Transjakarta dari Aksi Vandalisme"[Gambas:Video 20detik](mud/hns)

Transjakarta Boss Talks on the Importance of Transportation Business Management
05 Nov 2019, 09:47 by Mukhlis Dinillah


Photo: Mukhlis Dinillah / detikcom

Bandung - Implementation of knowledge management in the management of a company becomes important especially from the development of systems and human resources. This was also applied by the mass transportation service provider, Transjakarta. This was revealed in remarks by the President Director of Transjakarta Agung Wicaksono at the 3rd Knowledge Management Summit at the Hilton Hotel, Bandung City, Tuesday (11/05/2019). The theme raised was Innovative Learning to Use Knowledge Asset in Corporation and Public Services at Society 5.0.Agung said that every day Transjakarta serves 1 million passengers with a network reach of 250 kilometers. He said he was optimizing the digital system to meet the needs of consumers. "We have to take various approaches, for example, to have a digital application called Tijeku, how digital is used to manage services to the community," Agung said in his presentation. "We also have a command center system, controlling all "The number of Transjakarta bus networks is 3 thousand (units) throughout Jabodetabek. This is how knowledge management is applied in practice in Indonesian companies, especially in the transportation sector," added. In addition to system development, HR competencies in mastering information and digital technology must also be optimized. So, he continued, the current 4.0 industrial revolution is not a threat but a promising opportunity. "Especially in terms of the number of transportation HR is very large, Transjakarta HR is 10 thousand people, we are talking about Indonesia has a superior HR tagline, Indonesia is progressing, the key is transportation HR also must be ready to master information and digital technology and the role of knowledge management becomes important, "he said. The KTM Summit in 2019, which lasted for two days, became a joint place for sharing knowledge, experience for the creation of strategies and effective and efficient innovations. Especially the use of technology to accelerate an organization or company. In this activity present practitioners and academics in the field of KM and Innovative Learning to jointly prepare the Indonesian Human Capital to face the Industrial Era 4.0 and Era Society 5.0. These included Scot Osterweil, Founder & Creative Director of LGN, Aineias Gkikas and Prof. Mark Gilman from Birmingham City Business School, Dr. Serafin from the Philippines, Prof. Van Hong from Vietnam and a number of knowledge management experts in the country such as Prof. Aurik Gustomo from SBM ITB, Anisrul Waqie, Vice President of Quality System and KM Pertamina, Donald C. Lantu, Eko Nugroho and other expert speakers. Check out the video "Clearing the Transjakarta Bus Stop from Vandalism" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (mud / hns)
